comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: A view showing the completed Carrington Hotel, taken by Henry King about one or two years later (mid 1880s): (from Blue Mountains Library) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blue_mountains_library_-_local_studies/2672853070/in/photostream/] and Melvin Vaniman's panorama of Katoomba in 1903: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=412347

comment.author: 46046969@N03
comment._content: Amazing photo, a different scene today.

comment.author: 95027075@N00
comment._content: Fantastic, very changed. Are there maps of that time?

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/kjbeath]  Blue Mountains Library may have some early maps . Here is a later one from 1958:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/blue_mountains_library_-_local_studies/3564653819/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 95027075@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] My main question was how much of Katoomba was there when the hotel was built.

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/kjbeath] A road went past the area in the 1830s, with the local township and tourism slowly growing, and the name Katoomba adopted in the 1870s. Some history is here: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katoomba,_New_South_Wales
